title: Add an editable "Inside" section to the Home (Dashboard) page

requirements.text: Add a new Dashboard (Home page) card/section titled "Inside" that lets the user view and edit a freeform text block, similar to the existing "Quick Note" pattern, and persist its content in localStorage.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows a new card/section with the title "Inside".
The section supports toggling between read-only and edit mode (e.g., Edit/Save/Cancel) consistent with the existing "Quick Note" interactions.
The editable content persists across page reloads via localStorage using a new dedicated storage key (not reusing 'dashboard-note' or 'dashboard-title').
All user-facing text in this section is in English.

requirements.text: Place the new "Inside" section in a sensible location on the Dashboard page layout so it feels like part of the existing Home page flow and works well on mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: The "Inside" section appears on the Dashboard without overlapping other sections (Stats, Currently Working, Notifications/Charts, Quick Note, Subjects).
The layout remains responsive (no horizontal scrolling or broken grid) on small screens and large screens.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components are read-only).
Keep backend as single-actor Motoko architecture; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Adding backend persistence for the "Inside" content (localStorage-only is sufficient).
Changing existing Dashboard sections or removing any current features.
